reviewText:
Lots of action , lots of jumpscares , and alot of ♥♥♥♥ing pitch black lol . The flashlight will be your friend in this game .

I played it on normal mode for the first few hours , its easy , then mid to near end of the game , some areas can get big leaps in difficulty all the sudden then back to easy again . Still looks decent looking for its age (2004) . The weapons in this game are awesome and just so much fun to use (bfg gun wow! ) and even a chainsaw :O . Lots of ugly , scary looking creatures and demons to kill with all that ammo and big selection of weapons it gives you . So action horror fans should be pleased with this game for sure .

The end boss was dissapointing i thought , just a wee bit . Maybe just on normal mode it was too easy tbh . Performance wise , I never had a single issue with the game ( no crashes or whatever ) , it runs fine .

Dont buy the BFG edition , its not worth it . Just buy the normal/original version which is cheaper or buy the non steam version .My non steam copy only cost me £1 , and even that ran perfectly fine ( if your still able to find a copy somewhere )  .

I enjoyed the game , i would deffinetly recommend it for action/horror fans. You should play through this before the new DOOM game comes out so you get a feel for what its like , if you havent played any doom game before . I would highly , highly recommend the old versions(doom 1 and 2 ) aslong as you dont get put off by very dated graphics . Which are also on steam btw , they are fantastic .

reviewText:
It was really hard for me to recommend this game initially. I had played 5-6 levels and I was getting increasingly frustrated with the game. It felt nothing like Doom, and worse still it didn't feel fun at all. Read on and I'll tell you why you should get this game anyway.

First off: This game is old. It runs by default in 4:3 resolution. You can find several solutions to this in the forums.

Doom 3 tries really hard to be FEAR, Half-Life and Doom all at the same time. It takes a more realistic, dark and gritty approach to the original Doom storyline. It replaces frantic gun-blazing and monsterspamming with dark, gloomy and scary" corridors with fewer
date: more powerful enemies. This in itself is not a bad thing. After all
recommended: Half-Life was a great game!\n\nThe narrative is mostly told through voice overs or found PDAs. I kinda like this approach
hoursPlayed: it keeps you inside the world.\n\nWhere this game suffers really badly is the actual gameplay. It tries really hard to be scary and it shows. It's pretentious at best and ham-fisted at worst when it comes to the so called "scary moments" with color shifts
voteText: lights going out and comically overplayed "evil laughs" echoing through the halls.\n\nThe guns feel like pellet guns. There is no punch to any of the weapons
helpfulPercent: the sound assets for them are extremely weak and there is no satisfying feel to any of the weapons when you fire them. Enemies feel bullet-spongy and have a really annoying habit of not being present in the game world until you pass a certain trigger. This leads to excessively annoying moments where enemies keep coming from areas that you have already cleared. It's almost every single time you encounter enemies you'll have some coming from behind you. This can be cool for some panic induced fighting on occasion
votesHelpful: but this game does it every single time and it gets old FAST.\n\nNow
votesTotal: with all these problems
votesFunny: why do I recommend it? Because I got fed up and installed Doom 3 XTRA mod. This mod updates graphics
commentsCount: model assets
column16: textures and sounds to a more modern standard
column17: but it also fixes all the problems I have with the gameplay. By giving weapons more punch and over all more satisfying oomph and sounds
column18: it makes the shooting fun again. Sure the game is still overly pretentious with its scary "jack in a box" moments and enemies always coming from behind
column19: but you know what? With Doom 3 XTRA I don't give a ♥♥♥♥. Thar be demons to shoot in the face!\n\nSo in short
column20: if you intend to get this game don't even bother with the stock game. Doom 3 XTRA turns this game from a boring yawnfest into a frantic shooter with some ignorable issues."

reviewText: This is a great game to play even if it doesn't stick to the original DOOM and DOOM 2 game. I had fun shooting and blowing up spawns of satin while experiencing some of the jumpscares DOOM 3 had to offer. Having access to every weapon instead of limiting it to two is always fun to expierece because the more the marrier. Weapon progression in this game is enjoyable making players start form a lonely pistol to a BFG that kills everything in front of you because BIG F****** GUN! thats why. The plot is not simplified like the earlier titles but is still good and allows players to make a choice, a small one at that, to  send out a distress beacan or not . This choice is very minor and only effects the cutscene at the end making replaying the game for that choice not a big priority. The end boss battle feels a bit underwelming though as the player does nothing but run in a circle and wait for an item to charge up just to use it on the boss repeatedly. Finding PDA's for lore and locker codes is a great implimentation because it makes players search around the area if they want the goodies locked in that locker. Enemy variasion is good making players change tactics to tackle certain foes and introducing them is good as well. Replaying the game to have fun or experience a harder difficulty is fun and enjoyable as the game itself I feel can be played multiple times and still be fun. I recommend playing this game with sikkmod as it makes a game from 2003 look not only good but play better and smoother. Playing this game without sikkmod is okay too but the player will have to moddify the game anyway as the in game settings dosen't support 1920 by 1080p resolution. Information on the sikkmod modification and resoulution fix can be found in the forums.

reviewText: This is essiantially Half-Life 2 (when used with RoE) except for monster closets, satan, lower res graphics, crappy pistol models, and rooms darker than a middle school student's sense of humor. This isn't good as a Doom game, but when you look at it as a stand alone game, it's decent. The BFG Edition is highly reccomended if you want to use a flashlight and pump 20 pounds of buckshot into a security zombie who keeps dodging behind cover before you hit him. If you prefer a test of your insanity buy the original and hold the flashlight and bludgeon Imps with a flashlight while screaming, RIP AND TEAR!" and then proceed to get covered in small spiders that eventually kill you and use ur corpse as a nest. And then... the dead community of the multiplayer... more empty then the energy of that one nerdy
date: awkward kid in gym that no one really ever talks too. Overall I rate this game 6/10"

reviewText: Back in 2004 this gamed looked amazing and I scared the ♥♥♥♥ outta myself when I played this game when it was first released, and I hadn't really given it a good crack since then, so I bought it again and modded the ♥♥♥♥ out of it to find that - it looks amazing and I scared the ♥♥♥♥ outta myself again. Granted the textures can look a tad low-res without mods, but I suppose that's not so much a negative point as it is a fact of life - for a 10 year old game it's fantastic, and, true to id's style, it's still as fantastically playable as it was back then. Not to mention the fact that, while you adapt your tactics and learn to fight the enemies better as the game goes on - meaning perhaps you are less subtly scared that you were when you started the game -  it's still an anxiety-riddled, delightfully stressful experience from start to finish.\n\nHighly recommended, and if you like you can grab as many of the well-known graphics mods as you can to bring it into the next gen.

reviewText:
Welcome to Doom 3, where the UAC has built a huge base on Mars, which consists ENTIRELY of poorly lit twisting hallways with tiny rooms serving no apparent purpose other than for a single monster to hide in every one of them!

We at UAC take pride in our safety record, so please do not try grabbing ANY items whatsoever because if you do, those little monster closets WILL open and you WILL have your face eaten by malevolent demonic minions.

Yeah, go on, try and grab that shotgun, we dare you! We shall subsequently enjoy watching the floor unexplicably giving way, dropping you in the middle of a dark zombie infested labyrinth!

Oh, and also a demon has just teleported in, fresh out of hell, right behind your back. And he brought friends.

Enjoy your stay on Mars!

reviewText:
Doom 3 is an FPS Survival Horror game.  While I did not enjoy it as much as Doom and Doom 2, it still is a good.  It is a decent survival horror, with some tense and spooky moments.  I also recommend ot to Doom fans, to experience the re-imagined versions of their favorite monsters and weapons.  Combat can be fun and fast paced.  It is perfect for people who have played the original Dooms, and also are fans f the survival horror genre.  Graphics were decent for the time, and parts of the game required you to think and investigate your surroundings.  Although it starts out slow, the build up is necassary for you to start feeling uneasy before the action starts.

Although I enjoyed this game, I would have preferred a more modern rip n' tear game.

Now for the not so good stuff.  Keep in mind this is my opinion.  At times, they  jus throw enemies at you for extended periods.  Sometimes they aren't even strong enemies, and it is just annoying.  For example, the little skeleton spiders just keep coming and coming, and it smetimes breaks the flow of the game.  The guns do not feel very satisfying to fire, which is a minor complaint.  The darkness is also an issue.  The game would be IMPOSSIBLE to play through without the ductape mod to add a flashlight  your assault rifle and shotgun.  The mod does not ruin the atmosphere, and it encourage use of the default flashlight because the gun flashlights aren't as powerful.

All in all, I definitly enjoyed the game, being a fan of the originals and of survival horror.  However, it gets a 5/10 because it requires a mod to have fun gameplay.

Without Duct Tape mod: 5/10
With: 7/10

reviewText:
While I wouldn't really call it a Doom game, it is a fun horror and sci-fi shooter with decent graphics, cool weapons, and a lot of visual and technical mods that is still fun to play to this day.

Unfortunately, the Steam version has some serious problems. Graphical glitches and crashes to desktop are the smaller problems. However, I swear that at least ten times, the game has managed to crash my internet router. I don't know how it's happening, but I know all these bugs are at least directly correlated to how many times I load maps in the game in one sitting. Bottom line is that it's annoying, and it ruins the pacing at which the game can be enjoyed.

I suggest a hard copy. I had one once, and had none of the problems I've had with this version.

reviewText:
The game is still amazing, considering it has now 10 years on its back.

This feels old school enough....I had almost forgot how it was to shoot enemies who didn't just stay in cover and pop their heads out for you to get headshots with a pad (COD, anyone?). The marine-zombies will get your flanks, run at you and melee strike your face, and demons would throw fireballs from all sides.

Graphically it is also very well aged....doesn't look 'old' at all. Such a shame they did release the BFG edition....if you are wondering which one to get, get this version. This is the original version, the BFG version adds useless stuff and simplifies the game a lot (more ammo, less damage taken, holding the light while aiming and so on).

By editing the ini files you can choose whatever resolution you want. So there IS support for widescreen (not natively, just google and edit the necessary files). It runs perfectly even on my surface pro 2!

reviewText:
Now I will start of this review with I love this game but coming back to it I can't recommend playing the vanilla version of this game because the graphics of this version has not aged well I would recommend getting the Absolute HD 1.6 mod if you plan to buy this game.

So what can I say about Doom that hasn't already been said its gory, its bloody and just outright brutal but this game took it up a notch. You play as an unamed space marine stationed on Mars City run by the UAC (Union Aerospace Corporation) you happened to arrive on the same day something extraordinary happens where scientists decide to open a portal to hell but didn't think to shut it for some daft reason and it all goes to hell literally because lost souls, imps anything evil and nasty has come out to play with your body being their toy. This game happens to take a more survival horror approach with limited ammo, non-regenerative health and satan wanting to play a few too many pranks on you in many rooms and it works for the amount of time I have played this game which I mainly played it on the original Xbox I was really petrified and even more frightend on PC.
This is a short review because everyone knows what Doom is.
Overall Rating for the Vanilla version 7/10
Overall Rating for the HD mod version 9/10

reviewText: Doom 3 isn't a very good game unless you know how to create an autoexec.cfg file inside the Doom 3 Base folder.  That's especially true for the Steam version.  There are mods for Doom 3.  I recommend Cam's Gameplay Mod v2.6.  That mod will add a permanent flashlight to all guns and make the guns more effective.  Doom 3 can support high-resolution monitors if you add some commands to the autoexec.cfg file.  I've never played Doom 3 BFG Edition.  The fact that it doesn't support mods was what convinced me not to buy it.  Nevertheless, I've heard that the BFG Edition has smoother gameplay, a permanent flashlight for all guns, and slightly better graphics.

reviewText:
I didn't like doom 3 when i first played it about 5 years ago so i decided to buy the game on steam and give it another chance to see if my opinion changes. It hasn't.
This is one of the most boring games i have ever played and it feels like such a slap in the face to fans of doom 1 and 2 like myself. The shooting feels so clunky, the guns sound weak as hell and combat in general just feels stiff and awful.
It's one of the least scary 'horror' games i have ever played and I feel no tension as i'm playing it. The only scare that works is the bathroom mirror scare in the first hour of the game. Unless you are very easily scared this game cannot be called a horror game as it is marketed to be.
The enemy design is so uninteresting and boring compared to doom 1 and 2 which had some of the most interesting and memorable enemy design in gaming history its just sad to look at in doom 3.
The pacing is awful, you are fighting like 5 ememies at a time max and that's the most tension you will get out of the game is fighting a small bunch of enemies in very tight corridors. The pacing is very slow and boring. If the game didn't have such dull and boring level design and atmosphere maybe the slow pacing would have worked but it just doesn't.
I have used the word boring so many times in this review but that's honestly the best way i can describe the game and my experience with it. Boring.
3/10 (Bad)

reviewText: In its original form (ie without mods) Doom 3 is incredibly bland and unsatisfying. I tried to like it for so long because the graphics, at the time, were basically unmatched, like the Doom titles before it. But even as a young lad back in the early 2000s this game was way too boring for me. The combat itself fell incredibly flat even compared to the original Doom games. Enemy bodies disappear before they even hit the ground. The guns sound like ♥♥♥♥. The level design may have gone over well in the mid to late 90s but by the time this game came out it felt anachronistically bland - basically just long metal corridor after long metal corridor. Say what you want about Halo 1's level design, at least you'd go outside and have a change of scenery every once in a while. In this game, all you do is plod around and shoot at enemies with your clunky Mattel toy gun and watch as the enemies disappear before you have a chance to see the ragdoll physics, set in a universe where light only comes in two forms -  brighter than the sun or darker than space. I suspect alot of people are projecting their love of the series as a whole onto this game individually when they praise it.

reviewText:
So I just finished this, and here are my thoughts.

It's okay, though I really prefer the classic Doom titles. Has a very large horror theme, but it's not the same Doom.

Pros: Has veteran enemies, weapons, etc, has some references to the classic franchise.
Cons: The flashlight is very annoying when switching, Too dark, needs 16:9 support, Cyberdemon battle was very lame, earlier maps lacks ammo scattered, didn't really like the code input vaults idea, weapons are very weak.

6.5 / 10

I do know BFG Edition fixed some of these issues, but meh.
The game is not bad, nor good, it's only in the middle, mostly because im more used to the classic titles. I'd recommend this game if your into horror games.

reviewText:
--- DOOM 3 ---

The good stuff...

- Good graphics with audio in world class.
- Tight controls.
- Scary as hell! - DOOM 3 relay on audio/music to be scary and keep the player on edge at all times, just like any good horror movie - play it alone in the middle of the night with the volume cranked. Bring extra underwear.
- ID's attention to details are amazing as usual.
- The game has been nicely balanced and offer a challenge, even if you are good at shooters.

The bad stuff...

- A little too much emphasis on horror and lacking somewhat in the action department - it should be the other way around like the old-school DOOM games.
- Even if the environments are beautifully crafted they do get old pretty quick - it's tight, it's dark, there are long hallways with at least one jump scare somewhere..... rinse and repeat.

Final verdict...

8.5/10 - just buy the game - it's DOOM and it's good.

reviewText:
Doom and its sequel were THE BEST GAMES EVER in terms of good gunplay, fluid movement, twitch reaction, and replayability factor. This is NOT a Doom game.
Ridiculously dark, in an attempt to create a tense and scary atmosphere. If you dont fancy modding the game this means hours of walking into walls essentially feeling your way round the perimiters of small rooms full of random clutter that cannot simply be walked over, but has to be kicked, tripped over and caught on.
Depleting stamina bar means no unlimited running, seems a bit strange that someone would suddenly become too tired to jog when all manner of hellspawn are chasing after him.
Shotgun is a bad joke, easily possible to completely miss every pellet at a range of less than 2 meters. View flinch when hit is probably the worst i have ever seen in any game ever. This is not helped by the random swarms of small ankle biting monsters in totally dark corridors full of crap to trip over. These last few issues combined make this a painully bad experience.
Some people seem to think that getting triple slapped when you cant even see what youre supposed to be shooting at is an intended game mechanic that adds to the atmosphere. Are you for real?

Anyway il leave it down to you whether you think this is worth the purchase on nostalgia factor alone, but this review is coming from a lifelong doom fan who bought this game for less than £2, and i still feel as though i wasted my money.

reviewText:
This game is so lovely.
It beats the new Doom 4 game many times over and over again.

If you are standing for a choice between buying this,
or buying the new Doom 4, buy this instead.
(Or better: the BFG edition, then you get more for the bucks)
You will enjoy it much more, I promise you.

This review applies to Doom 3 and RoE,
not the other doom games inside this package.

First, you get that nice peaceful playable intro
without action that almost every game have today.
Such intros always gives you a nice entrypoint
(where you come from and why) while it starts up"
the story in a proper way
date:
and also gives a exploration
opportunity to learn more about the
in-game world without being disturbed by enemies.

Then
recommended: you get pretty much thinking.\nYou must read PDA's
hoursPlayed: Emails
helpfulPercent:
figure out codes to proceed. Sometimes you need
to read Emails or listen to logs to figure out what to
do next
votesHelpful: for example where specific mission-critical\nobjects are stored.\nAnd you get no help
votesTotal:
you need to figure out platforming
for yourself when that becomes applicable.
That makes it extra fun.

reviewText:
A sub par, generic FPS with a popular name attached to it with a forgettable story included.

Its barely even a DOOM game if your basis for DOOM is 1 or 2.

The game can be summed up as a slow, linear plod through corridors as enemies obviously spawn directly infront and behind you over and over and over. Situations are reused to the point you just get used to looking behind you everytime an enemy spawns infront of you and if theres one four legged beast enemy theres probably going to be another spawning after you kill the first.

Its pathetically boring after you see that its just monster closets and triggers rehashed over and over and over with the same basic scenario.

Of course theres the jump scares earlier in the game but after about halfway through the game you see just about all the fear you are going to get out of the game and it becomes extremely boring.The shooting feels weak and the shotguns a POS and most weapons are pretty worthless. Shotgun for close range, Plasma for damage dealing, and SMG for anyhing to far for the shot gun is what I went by. You do get access to a pistol, minigun, and a rocket launcher but they are pretty useless outside of specific situations.

The puzzles add nothing and most the time add up to finding a button and pressing the ♥♥♥♥ out of that single button or finding a keycode on a PDA in the area then typing that into a lockbox. It sucks, slows the game down and adds nothing to the mechanics of the game. My only guess is that FPS puzzles were the thing, and as HL2 was coming out the same year I guess they thought they would have to have them to compete or some stupid reason. Atleast HL2 puzzles require a bit of wit and have interesting physics to them.

I won't be completing this game as its absolutely nothing and is the reason I could not care less about Doom 4. I would rather play FEAR again.

reviewText:
You can mod this game as much as you want to make it look as sexy as possible, this game is just not fun. It's gray, dull, slow, not exciting and really, not that scary. You walk slowly, use boring weapon against really slow monsters, the game very rarely throws you more than one monster at once, so the enemies are more there for spook purposes than for combat.

If you were hoping for a fast-paced action shooter like the original doom games, this isn't for you.
If you were looking for a atmospheric scary game, there is much better stuff out there. If you were looking for a repetitive unexciting corridor shooter featuring repetitive unexciting shooting, look no further.

reviewText: This is the least DOOM-like of all the DOOM games. They went with a survival horror feel, and it works, but it's not DOOM. In a series that is known for being able to zip around and chain together multiple kills with multiple weapons in large and open areas, having to manually switch out your weapon for a flashlight every time you want to see in the small, claustrophic environments doesn't quite feel right. If you're a fan of survival horror, more power to you.\n\nGet the BFG edition if you want to play a version that feel more like DOOM. More graphical settings for modern resolutions, and comes with Doom 1 and 2 and Resurrection of Evil

reviewText:
Doom 3.

General overview - average.
Graphics - 5/10
Sounds - 7/10
Mechanics - 7/10
Storyline - 6/10
Time to complete - around 12-16 hours.

Prologue of the story - The year is 2145. You are an unknown marine sent to a Mars station to reinforce the troops stationed there. Recently there have been many occupants becoming ill and even dying. On board your flight is a councillor from earth to investigate the recent happenings. You are required to grab your equipment and report for duty. This is where your hellish story begins.

This game was released in 2004 and naturally, the graphics look dated. Some aspects are in HD like interactive computer monitors but most of the decals are very pixelated including your weapons which is a shame. The sound is above average with reasonable voice acting but the guns definately needed to sound like they have a heavier punch.

There is a variety of weapons from chainsaws, chainguns, rocket launchers, granades and everything in between to put to good use against the enemy. If you search out the nooks and crannies you will find enough ammunition to keep you going. The AI are generally stupid and will persue you except for the marines. Sometimes they take cover.

The story is slowly revealed to you through a bunch of PDAs the lab scientists have dropped. Not only do they reveal story plots but some will also have codes to gain access to storage lockers. Another cool aspect was having to go outside the station with a limited oxygen supply. It gives a real sense of dread of suffication. To add to the suspense you must lower your weapon to use a flash light. Some will find this a nuisanse if they just want a plain run and gun game.

Conclusion : Don't expect epic content from this game but if you'd like to take a crack at a classic then this would definately count.

Other notes : I had problems choosing a higher resolution to play the game in. It would always crash when I chose which one I wanted. Please check the guides for a work around to get better resolutions. It involves typing commands into the console. Unfortunately you have to do this everytime you open the game. I have a G15 keyboard so I bound the commands to one of my macro keys. Minimised the annoyance.

reviewText:
While it is a definitely solid game, I can't recommend you to spent 15-20 hours of your life on it.
Doom 3 is not a fast-paced straightforward shooter, instead it tries to be a survival horror and ultimately fails.

Pros:
+excellent, unnerving atmosphere. It kept me under pressure till the end.
+darkness. It's everywhere. You never feel safe.
+sound design. All kinds of growls, rustles, whispers to keep the tension.

Cons:
-level design. All levels in the game look the same. After finishing it you will remember only one, all others are just set of corridors. No open Mars terrain, no Mars cities, just base corridors. Bores you to death.
-a LOT of backtracking.
-very limited set of monsters.
-although suspense is present, the game scares you mostly with a set of cheap tricks - like monsters appearing behind your back.
-overall repetitiveness
-NO replay value

reviewText:
So with this installment they went with a shock horror theme, which basically means instead of trying to instill fear gracefully and through tampering with the players mind, they send you through a bunch of dark corridors carrying a limited flashlight and send monsters out to go BOO. Basically, the kind of thing that's scary for all of 2 seconds when your gameplay is based around having a ♥♥♥♥♥on of guns and a boorish atmosphere.

The gunplay itself is pretty generic too, and you can tell a game's bad when you don't even remember it a few months down. I remember one long elevator ride, and at the end you go to hell and fight the cyberdemon, and the rest is a jumbled mess of dark corridors. if I've mentioned that before, it's because there's not much else.

It's like the devs changed or never really knew what made their games good, I don't know. Whichever it is, piece of trash, don't buy.

reviewText:
Doom, the movie is better.

I bought this game as part of some collection I think, but I never actually played it before now and it's pretty obvious within the first few hours that I didn't miss anything at all.

At best this game is slightly entertaining, at worst it's clunky, boring and stupid, which puts it somewhat below average in general. It's never really challenging, because of a ♥♥♥♥-poor AI and annoying mechanics.

In the movie all the marines have flashlights mounted to their guns. In the game you either wield a flashlight or a gun and the game is extremely dark, which means you'll be switching constantly, but what's worse is that the lighting is even worse. I find the night-blind setting to be quite annoying. I can't even see an enemy two steps away, because there is no reflection or sphere of light at all - but they can see me; always. I think it's supposed to be scary, but it isn't. It's just annoying.

Whenever I get hit I am pushed back a little, which distracts my shots, but whenever I hit an enemy, with a shotgun blast or whatever they either die or nothing happens. And the enemies, all they do is sit around and wait for me, to make a leap at me when I open a door or turn my back to a dark corner.

Using grenades is just plain stupid. They behave like rubber balls. Trying to lob a nade through a window or on a step ahead or just above me and the nade bounce off the edge or a wall and back in my face nine times out of ten. I end up looking straight up at the cealing in order to lob a nade up on a level right above me. It's the worst pitching mechanic I've ever seen.

There are too many triggers. Enemies spawn from areas I've already cleaned out. Not just those that teleport in, but possessed marines as well. Every time I find armor, clips, healing or anything I suddenly got a monster in my face, that just magically appear out of nowhere.

I never get the feeling that I am anything else than a guy sitting at a keyboard playing a lame shooter and everytime I get bloodsplatters on the screen I get the feeling that I've just got a view from a camera mounted on the back of my marine.

My time is pretty evently divided between killing zombies (or whatever they are, all of them) and looking for keycards, which is really too long. During the course of the game I found different keypads, which includes pointless chit-chat, audio logs and a few useful security codes, but I have to look through them all manually, which is bloody annoying, especially because the design of mail windows are so small, that I have to scroll a lot through messages. I really wish, that the game would have had some kind of intelligence, registering the keypads and just unlock all the lockers as I pick up the datapads with codes for them.

There are also audio logs with voice-recordings, but the voices are.. too whiney and annoying. It would have been interesting if there was a mystery to unravel, but it's just doom. There are a few nice voices, but voices generally suck, because they lack character, personality and point.

Somehow it feels as if Doom 3 wants to be System Shock 2 with better graphics, but it fails miserably at the gameplay. There is only action and it's primitive and repetitious. Doom 3 borrows liberally from a lot of different games to create a boring, predictable and forgettable story. It really shows a genuine lack of inspiration for this game other than adding bragging rights about graphics and visual appeal.

It's a pretty fast-paced game and it's easy to quit. It's just that kind of game. Fast-in, fast-out. No addiction. I imagine I will just do one play-through and then the game will disappear in the dust of old and forgotten games. I didn't get that far. At the end it was just too boring. What a drop.

reviewText:
This game is without question the worst game in the doom series.

This game's biggest problem is the underpowered weapons with bullet sponge enemies. The shotgun in the game is a joke. Each pellet does pathetic damage, and you can get spread that will hit the floor and the celing at a range of maybe 10 feet? It takes 2 shots at point blank to kill an Imp. Like do i really need to say anything else?

Enemy AI is pretty good for the soldiers. They take cover and are a genuine challenge. Imps crawl around and don't use much strategy, but they're imps so that's to be expected. Caoco demons just sort of float towards you, which isn't really that impressive.

Other than that, the game was supposed to be about atmosphere and being a horror game, which it does well. It's genuinly scary at times and presents a good atmosphere and the story isn't half bad.

That said, the gameplay is terrible due to the pathetic weapons. 4/10. Go ahead and play it, but don't expect something more than what it is.

When I first played Doom 3 I thought it was just so-so; a shooter that controlled well with a nice engine and cool lighting, but not a Doom game. I've grown to change my mind, and in fact this has become one of my very favourite games. I've played this thing over and over and over and it gets better every single time.

id's engine is nothing short of miraculous. The level design is tight (though sometimes unremarkable and confusing) and the player can hide behind, jump on, and squeeze through everything you'd expect. The use of shadow in the design is superior to any other game, and having to juggle between a gun and a flashlight, even though it's ridiculous, adds tension and fun.

The monsters are a loving homage to the original games. The animations are incredible and become spookier every time I upgrade my PC (especially with my 144hz monitor - it's SO fluid). They're fun to fight and id kept the important mechanic of having the player run faster than any other enemy, making movement your most effective weapon. That's the key ingredient of Doom and that's what makes Doom 3 a true sequel.

It's fun to navigate, it's fun to shoot, and every moment is full of tension and wonder as you explore. Doom 3 is a gem and I can confidently call it a desert island game". I never seem to get tired of it."

Played this game since I was in middle school, and years later, it still stands up today. The old school Doom fans may not like D3's horror style of gameplay and lean toward the classic run 'n gun mechanics but D3 fulfills its own niche. Definitely choose this version over the BFG edition, as it has massive mod support. Sikkmod makes this game look better than the BFG edition, and other mods such as the LMS 4.0 (Wave survival, Custom coop) and OpenCoop (campaign and custom coop) provide extreme replayability. A ton of custom single player modded maps are also available for your choosing, most notably Tested and the Ultimate Hell Campaign. At $12 for the doom 3 + ROE pack, this is a steal, and even more so during steam sales.

Doom 3 is a badass first-person horror shooter developed by id Software. Takes place on Mars in 2145 and all hell has broken loose!

The game is scary since it’s using the two of the main horror elements: Darkness and sound. You never know what’s around the next corner and you have to make your way through puzzles, zombies and demons. YES! I said demons! What are they doing on Mars? Well I won’t spoil the story.

Mind you this game is creepy, look out for the babies (Yup, you read it right the first time).

Even though the game is showing its age the id Tech 4 game engine is still impressive even in 2013.

If you’re up for a nice corridor shooter, then pick up Doom 3 now.

Doom 3 is a decent game, though it has many problems.

The opening sections have an atmosphere that is unparalleled, and there are intermittent scenes that are also great. That said, partway through the game it becomes a much more generic game that lapses in its scariness. If you take away the darkness and you hold down the run key, the game is basically the same run and gun shooters its predecessors were in many sections. If you were a huge fan of the first games and this is what you like, then that's great. If you're looking for something deeper than that, then you may have to try harder to immerse yourself. As I said, the beginning definitely is everything it is advertised to be. Later in the game, though, I found myself getting very bored and hoping the game would end.

Most of the enemies just jump toward you and are designed to fluster you. It's not really scary for the most part, but if you are easily scared as I was as a young teenager playing this game, it will freak you out. It becomes predictable as well. Enemies spawn in most rooms, you gun them down, then you repeat in the next room. The formula works out for a while, but by the time you get to, say, the Delta Labs, you'll be wishing the game would throw something new at you. The boss fights are exciting decent but easy, perhaps with the exception of the Cyberdemon that appears in every Doom game ever.

Many people complain about not being able to use the flashlight and shoot at the same time. While it can be annoying at first, once you get good at switching it actually works pretty well. I know the new BFG edition allows you to use both, but I feel like that would kill the experience too much. It adds a new level of strategy and horror, so don't be too put off by it.

There's not much of a storyline, but there really doesn't need to be. You're just trying to survive and make it through the Mars base, eventually defeating the demonic forces, while hitting a number of objectives along the way.

The graphics are good, about what you'd expect from a game made back in 2003. The facial animations are terrible (except for the player's own and a few notable other NPCs), but the rest is decent. The mirrors actually work though! This is something most developers try to avoid, but id Software did them right!

I would definitely recommend this game to people wanting a decent horror experience, but I warn that it will get repetitive about halfway through the game. If you can look past that, it is a very fun horror shooting experience!

Doom 3 is a mixed bag in some cases. On one hand, it manages to be a solid horror game with plenty of scares, scary concepts, and dark spooky rooms. On the other, that just isn't what Doom is. Doom is a fast-paced action game with bunny-hopping, weapon swapping, and non-stop genocidal mayhem. It's about as far from the original Doom as possible in that regard. I personally enjoy the sound design and music, though YMMV. The dark rooms are irritating to some, and while I do agree that the dark rooms themselves are an ordeal, it doesn't feel unintentional. And sure, if you want to completely remove the horror aspect of it then by all means get the BFG edition where you can hold your flashlight and weapon at the same time. But for people who accept it as a horror game, and want to enjoy it as a horror game, and also accept it as a completely different game from Doom, then it is well worth your time. Go check it out.

Where many teams (such as DICE) show huge capability at infusing fresh elements into shooters for enhancement, id have (for twenty years) proven that they are the ultimate in both understanding and designing raw FPSs. This game is the very embodiment of that proof. Taking its heart from the 1990s and infusing it into a graphics-rich world, this is a shooting gallery filled with claustrophobic atmosphere and tension to its very core, with the restraint to pace itself to give you time to immerse - one of only two FPSs in history to truly do so. This game puts effort into you - and wholly deserves it in return. A masterpiece that stands the test of time as games 'modernise' to become more casual, more open, and more disposable. Unequivocally and unrestrainedly recommended.

I'm going to give Doom 3 an actual recommendation because I really think it is one of the more underrated games. Doom 3 is iD's attempt to revitalize the classic Doom series 10 years later. Doom 3 departs from the explore the floor" style of older Doom games and is instead an attempt at a more linear/scripted action-horror game that was in my opinion pretty successful. The engine is a bit dated so the monsters don't have the frightening look going for them like the ones in newer games
date: but there's a great atmosphere that the game fosters of an invisible entity orchestrating the events happening around you. Most of the "spooks" come from the lights going out or the game applying the overused red filter to the display and then having a bunch of monsters come at you. While not nearly as frightening as Frictional's horror games (Penumbra/Amnesia)

Some scares can be predicted but other are extremely difficult to see coming. One that really got me was when i was walking through a hallway and all the lights go out, no visibility and i was too afraid to put down my gun, then a monster just jumps out at me. I screamed and accidentally paused the game. I love scarey games and this one is a must, it makes you second guess on if you want to play it again. I know this game's old news now but I still think it's exceptionally well-made. I found it to keep true to classic Doom in a lot of ways - you'll find a lot of the same enemies and items, and of course the scary feel is there as well, as anything could jump out at you at any time. The creepiness is helped by a great build-up at the start. It's a good balance between scary and action, though. Throughout the game you will make use of a PDA which is a clever way of keeping track of security keys, which will give you access to secrets and new areas, while also giving you some comical background about life on the station before the whole demonic invasion thing.

Doom 3 is a mixed bag in some cases. On one hand, it manages to be a solid horror game with plenty of scares, scary concepts, and dark spooky rooms. On the other, that just isn't what Doom is. Doom is a fast-paced action game with bunny-hopping, weapon swapping, and non-stop genocidal mayhem. It's about as far from the original Doom as possible in that regard. I personally enjoy the sound design and music, though YMMV. The dark rooms are irritating to some, and while I do agree that the dark rooms themselves are an ordeal, it doesn't feel unintentional. And sure, if you want to completely remove the horror aspect of it then by all means get the BFG edition where you can hold your flashlight and weapon at the same time. But for people who accept it as a horror game, and want to enjoy it as a horror game, and also accept it as a completely different game from Doom, then it is well worth your time. Go check it out.
Shoot and scoot.

Doom 3 is a decent game, though it has many problems.

The opening sections have an atmosphere that is unparalleled, and there are intermittent scenes that are also great. That said, partway through the game it becomes a much more generic game that lapses in its scariness. If you take away the darkness and you hold down the run key, the game is basically the same run and gun shooters its predecessors were in many sections. If you were a huge fan of the first games and this is what you like, then that's great. If you're looking for something deeper than that, then you may have to try harder to immerse yourself. As I said, the beginning definitely is everything it is advertised to be. Later in the game, though, I found myself getting very bored and hoping the game would end.

Most of the enemies just jump toward you and are designed to fluster you. It's not really scary for the most part, but if you are easily scared as I was as a young teenager playing this game, it will freak you out. It becomes predictable as well. Enemies spawn in most rooms, you gun them down, then you repeat in the next room. The formula works out for a while, but by the time you get to, say, the Delta Labs, you'll be wishing the game would throw something new at you. The boss fights are exciting decent but easy, perhaps with the exception of the Cyberdemon that appears in every Doom game ever.

Many people complain about not being able to use the flashlight and shoot at the same time. While it can be annoying at first, once you get good at switching it actually works pretty well. I know the new BFG edition allows you to use both, but I feel like that would kill the experience too much. It adds a new level of strategy and horror, so don't be too put off by it.

There's not much of a storyline, but there really doesn't need to be. You're just trying to survive and make it through the Mars base, eventually defeating the demonic forces, while hitting a number of objectives along the way.

The graphics are good, about what you'd expect from a game made back in 2003. The facial animations are terrible (except for the player's own and a few notable other NPCs), but the rest is decent. The mirrors actually work though! This is something most developers try to avoid, but id Software did them right!

I would definitely recommend this game to people wanting a decent horror experience, but I warn that it will get repetitive about halfway through the game. If you can look past that, it is a very fun horror shooting experience!
Scary and tense FPS

There were a few really cool ideas in Doom 3. I loved the introduction level, especially that ghostly skull popping out of the TV and then posessing that guy who visually transforms right before your eyes into a zombie-like creature. I loved how this elevator door opened, revealing some zombie-soldier, whereby I got shocked a bit and blasted his head with my shotgun. I remember my bro laughing as his brain basically popped out. About the 3rd level I liked how the lights switched off, it was completely dark! And when I blasted away with the machine gun, you could see the muzzle flashes reflect on the zombies in a rather artistic kind of way. I really disliked this game overall. But here comes the eye-opener! After completing the game, I viewed the credits and to my surprise it was only a handful of people who created Doom 3. You could even say it was almost an Indie game. And that deserves recognition.

I know this game's old news now but I still think it's exceptionally well-made. I found it to keep true to classic Doom in a lot of ways - you'll find a lot of the same enemies and items, and of course the scary feel is there as well, as anything could jump out at you at any time. The creepiness is helped by a great build-up at the start. It's a good balance between scary and action, though. Throughout the game you will make use of a PDA which is a clever way of keeping track of security keys, which will give you access to secrets and new areas, while also giving you some comical background about life on the station before the whole demonic invasion thing.

Doom 3 is a mixed bag in some cases. On one hand, it manages to be a solid horror game with plenty of scares, scary concepts, and dark spooky rooms. On the other, that just isn't what Doom is. Doom is a fast-paced action game with bunny-hopping, weapon swapping, and non-stop genocidal mayhem. It's about as far from the original Doom as possible in that regard. I personally enjoy the sound design and music, though YMMV. The dark rooms are irritating to some, and while I do agree that the dark rooms themselves are an ordeal, it doesn't feel unintentional. And sure, if you want to completely remove the horror aspect of it then by all means get the BFG edition where you can hold your flashlight and weapon at the same time. But for people who accept it as a horror game, and want to enjoy it as a horror game, and also accept it as a completely different game from Doom, then it is well worth your time. Go check it out.

For me to call doom 3 a traditional doom game would be a flat out lie. It lacks mostly everything that made the doom games so great, levels are much more linear (still not as bad as many modern shooter) and it's less of a frantic fast paced action game and more of a slow, atmospheric horror game. There's nothing wrong with the latter of course, it's just a different approach to the series. The gunplay is solid thought there's nothing exceptional, the weapons are taken from the orginial doom, with a couple exceptions, such as the interesting soul cube. Monsters are taken from classic doom as well, which is great. It's quite a sight to see how monsters such as the cacodemon and mancubus translated into the Tech 4 Engine. The issue is the most iconic monster, the pinky" demon is so grossly underused. I think I counted maybe 8 in the entire game? However
date: my biggest complain with the game is the lack of variety in the levels. The entire games takes place on a base on mars

I'm going to give Doom 3 an actual recommendation because I really think it is one of the more underrated games. Doom 3 is iD's attempt to revitalize the classic Doom series 10 years later. Doom 3 departs from the explore the floor" style of older Doom games and is instead an attempt at a more linear/scripted action-horror game that was in my opinion pretty successful. The engine is a bit dated so the monsters don't have the frightening look going for them like the ones in newer games
date: but there's a great atmosphere that the game fosters of an invisible entity orchestrating the events happening around you. Most of the "spooks" come from the lights going out or the game applying the overused red filter to the display and then having a bunch of monsters come at you. While not nearly as frightening as Frictional's horror games (Penumbra/Amnesia)
recommended: the approach to horror it takes is closer to those games than something like Dead Space
hoursPlayed: which is more like "monsters jump out at you as a loud noise plays: the game". While there are a few "jump" bits in the game
voteText: most of what made me enjoy Doom 3 was the atmosphere and the background noise that contributed to the experience. The gameplay overall is closer to Quake II than Doom
helpfulPercent: with the more linear format but still having little secrets around you can find. Overall a decent successor to Doom in my opinion."

Doom 3 obviously had a lot to live up to.    Doom was on more pcs than Windows was at the time of it's release.  Fuled by shareware, and college computer networks that allowed for lan games Doom and Doom 2 were like the worlds greatest virus.  I still remember the first time I saw doom in action.  It was Doom 2 to be exact.  I was with a firend at their uncles house, when i saw it on his PC.   Doom was kind of like Street Fighter 2, or Super Mario Bros, in that it changed my view on what video games could be.  I must not have been alone, because after doom, and ever since FPS games have dominated the market.  For the longest time all FPS games were called Doom Clones.   Doom and Doom 2 also happen to be the first games iever played online co-op on.  Another game changer for me.  You mean we can play together and be at our oen houses?  holy ♥♥♥♥!


Fast forward to Doom 3.  Does this game grab me like the first 2 games did back in the mid ninties?  No.  Is it the greatest FPS I ever played.  Not close.  Does it even make sense?  Why the hell do I need a flashlight, and if I do, why can't it be on my gun.  I thought this was the future.

This game gets bashed a lot because of the fact it will never live up to the original two, but over all it is a solid experience.  It has interesting enemies, and the sounds effects are fantastic.  Turn off the lights, crank the volume and ♥♥♥♥ your pants, as you are dropped through the floor into a room full of zombies (if you're lucky)  ready to eat your face.  This game has updated versions of many of the original games monsters, plus plenty of new ones. They all have a habit of trying to scare you to death so that's fun.


I'd give this like a 8 on th 1 - 10 scale as far as FPS games go.

When I first played Doom 3 I thought it was just so-so; a shooter that controlled well with a nice engine and cool lighting, but not a Doom game. I've grown to change my mind, and in fact this has become one of my very favourite games. I've played this thing over and over and over and it gets better every single time.

id's engine is nothing short of miraculous. The level design is tight (though sometimes unremarkable and confusing) and the player can hide behind, jump on, and squeeze through everything you'd expect. The use of shadow in the design is superior to any other game, and having to juggle between a gun and a flashlight, even though it's ridiculous, adds tension and fun.

The monsters are a loving homage to the original games. The animations are incredible and become spookier every time I upgrade my PC (especially with my 144hz monitor - it's SO fluid). They're fun to fight and id kept the important mechanic of having the player run faster than any other enemy, making movement your most effective weapon. That's the key ingredient of Doom and that's what makes Doom 3 a true sequel.

It's fun to navigate, it's fun to shoot, and every moment is full of tension and wonder as you explore. Doom 3 is a gem and I can confidently call it a desert island game". I never seem to get tired of it."

Atmospheric and claustrophobic, Doom 3 is a legendary corridor shooter that emphasizes on tense gameplay and stunning visuals, with a few puzzles and jump scares thrown in for variety. Being more a remake of the first Doom than a sequal, the weapons and monsters feel a bit uninspired and obligatory but at it's core, Doom 3 is still as thrilling today as it was revolutionary for the time.

Where many teams (such as DICE) show huge capability at infusing fresh elements into shooters for enhancement, id have (for twenty years) proven that they are the ultimate in both understanding and designing raw FPSs. This game is the very embodiment of that proof. Taking its heart from the 1990s and infusing it into a graphics-rich world, this is a shooting gallery filled with claustrophobic atmosphere and tension to its very core, with the restraint to pace itself to give you time to immerse - one of only two FPSs in history to truly do so. This game puts effort into you - and wholly deserves it in return. A masterpiece that stands the test of time as games 'modernise' to become more casual, more open, and more disposable. Unequivocally and unrestrainedly recommended.
This mix of FPS and survival horror definitely must be played by those who enjoy the style. The combination of action, horror and science fiction makes Doom 3 one of the best games I ever played.

Played this game since I was in middle school, and years later, it still stands up today. The old school Doom fans may not like D3's horror style of gameplay and lean toward the classic run 'n gun mechanics but D3 fulfills its own niche. Definitely choose this version over the BFG edition, as it has massive mod support. Sikkmod makes this game look better than the BFG edition, and other mods such as the LMS 4.0 (Wave survival, Custom coop) and OpenCoop (campaign and custom coop) provide extreme replayability. A ton of custom single player modded maps are also available for your choosing, most notably Tested and the Ultimate Hell Campaign. At $12 for the doom 3 + ROE pack, this is a steal, and even more so during steam sales.

Doom 3 is a badass first-person horror shooter developed by id Software. Takes place on Mars in 2145 and all hell has broken loose!

The game is scary since it’s using the two of the main horror elements: Darkness and sound. You never know what’s around the next corner and you have to make your way through puzzles, zombies and demons. YES! I said demons! What are they doing on Mars? Well I won’t spoil the story.

Mind you this game is creepy, look out for the babies (Yup, you read it right the first time).

Even though the game is showing its age the id Tech 4 game engine is still impressive even in 2013.

If you’re up for a nice corridor shooter, then pick up Doom 3 now.

Peace.

Can you hear that, you might think i'm going crazy but if you play this game you'll start to dread the dark as you become friends with the most unlikely companion a flashlight. If you've played the first two original DOOM games then play the third in the series as you take on the role of as you guess it an unknown Marine. Trapped on Mars UAC facility you need to engineer your escape but in the most unlikely place, let's just say Welcome to Hell. And if you enjoyed the DOOM series then prepare for the release of DOOM 4 coming to a PC near you.

9/10

Not as good as doom 1 and 2. Still really good and scray not as scary as some games today. The flashlight you have to use seperate and cant be used with your guns.

Mods work with this game very well.

I never played this game when it was launched ten years ago prob cause I was addicted to the call of duty games and Operation Flashpoint.  I was also probably a bit defensive over the original doom games which i used to play on linked up playstations, game boy advance and PC's not to mention on the Jaguar.  Another factor may have been my out of spec pc at the time.\n\nOverall I would say this game has aged beautifully.  It plays like a doom game, looks like a doom game and what do you know is a bloody doom game.  The lighting is amazing and the level design is pretty good.  I enjoy the beasts and the fat weapons.  Its mindless killing fun good for unwinding with if you can't face a tactical shooter or being abused by children on online games.

Pretty fun.

Beat the campaign on hard in about 12 hours, and it offered a fun challenge. Some parts can be 2spooky, while others focus on shooting so there's a good mix. Lots of secrets hidden around aswell, in audio logs and locked doors/cabinets, aswell as meeting some survivors.

Does get slightly repetitive towards the end though, and the final boss battle wasn't as epic as I pictured, but was still worthwhile.

Solid 7/10. I'd recommend playing through it on hard, simply because it makes the game more fun.
The foundation of modern survival horror. Intense, gory action in creative environments against some of the most terrifying enemies to ever been conceived. Fun for the whole family.

Avoid the ♥♥♥♥ out of the HD one, stick to the original.

DOOM 3 is a fun game, quite worthy of the title DOOM. Despite being hard work making a sequel to the eternal classic DOOM and DOOM 2 Hell on Earth, Id software did it anyway and delivered a game quite similar to both of them, but evolved and adapted to modern graphics and gaming mechanics. DOOM 3 has it all: Imps, possessed soldiers, helldemons, flying skulls, hellbarons and the BFG. It also has a fun and scary storyline about the martian base being slowly devoured by hell due to teleporting experiments and some new elements, like the soul cube. A decent FPS game for newer gamers and a fun nostalgic game for everyone who played the original DOOM.

If you want Bfg Edition for the original 2 Doom games, just get them on their own. Doom 1, 2, and 3 don't have mod compatibility in that version.\n\nAnyway, this game is a must have if you're a fan of the fps genre.

With gameplay alone, it's an above average shooter, but the ambience is great; most notably, the ambient sounds are superb and memorable. I would describe this as a haunted attraction where the (well costumed) actors actually attack you and you have to fight back. It's a ride, an experience and DOOM3 pulls it off nicely. The story is far from strong, but it's compelling enough and, with some imagination, can lead to more horrifying conclusions. The voice acting is good and, to reiterate, the sounds are what drives this home. If you like this game, check out the Resurrection of Evil expansion.

Doom 1 and 2 are among my favorite games. Their sheer action, speed, and constant stream of enemies make them timeless. Doom 3 is somewhat different... with a focus more on horror and tense moments. One minute you're stressing about how dark and creepy the rooms you're in are, the next you're struggling to fight off 5-10 demons from all angles. I highly recommend this game to FPS and Horror fans; the game has aged quite well even after 10 years.

On of my favourite shooters of all time! Just began to play it again and it's still great!!! It combines a great plot, classic shooter and an intense horror feel. Far more original, nor just ANOTHER Call of Duty, far more thrilling, far more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ your pants... Doom 1 and 2 are among my favorite games. Their sheer action, speed, and constant stream of enemies make them timeless. Doom 3 is somewhat different... with a focus more on horror and tense moments. One minute you're stressing about how dark and creepy the rooms you're in are, the next you're struggling to fight off 5-10 demons from all angles. I highly recommend this game to FPS and Horror fans; the game has aged quite well even after 10 years.

Extremely fantastic game! Great graphics for its time. This game is so great I have it on a lot of my consoles (including the originals). The DOOM franchise is great, and I have been playing DOOM games since I was little!

While the game has it's flaws, I personally think it's better than than the first two. It not only looks better (and still looks great even today) but the combat is better as well. The enemy AI is better so it makes combat less repetitive, more exciting, and there are a lot of different enemies, some of which appeared in the old games (but are updated with better AI in Doom 3), and some new.

While some weapons aren't realistic all of them are enjoyable to use.

The only thing I really hate about this game is, sadly, the final boss. It is one of the easiest if not the easiest final boss I know of. I don't know what id was thinking. It makes for an anticlimactic ending.

But don't let that discourage you. Along with Half-Life 2 (which by the way also has a very easy ending), I've played Doom 3 so many times I've lost count (not on this Steam account, though). The game is definitely a must play.

DOOM 3 flawlessly creates an immersive survival horror fps, which is great fun to play through and explore. The game is genuinely challenging on harder difficulties, including Nightmare mode, and features excellent gunplay.

Sound design is masterful, as well as the game's artistic style. Everything looks and sounds right in every situation. The aesthetic of Hell in particular is particularly unnerving, you can tell that the guys who made this had a good time imaging creepy stuff.

All the guns from DOOM return, from the lowly pistol, all the way up to the devastating BFG 9000. Another of the game's strong points is that every gun, including the aformentioned pistol, feels powerful.

The monsters also return, with a few new ones, and have been given (at the time) modern facelifts. Imps are just as annoying as ever, and Hell Knights are particularly terrifying.

The game is also jam packed with lore and collectable goodies to discover. Read the PDAs of your fallen comrades to reveal personal emails and voice recordings which tell you everything about the situation, as well as other funny situations they may have been in.

All in all, DOOM 3 provides a memorable horror FPS experience which, despite its age, holds up well to this day. If you don't own this, get it, whether it's on sale or not.

reviewText: Made by Id software, the creaters of FPS, Doom 3 is an amazing game that throws you into the pits of Hell. Armed with your trusty flashlight and an arsenal of weapons that you receive throughout the game you are to fight the most demonic demons and zombies. Very intense gameplay and quite a scary game. This game you do not get rewards for killing a demon or getting through a mission, it gets harder and more demonic. This is not a game for casual gamers or people who like gifts in games. This is for the hardcore gamers, who willying  will throw themselfs into the pits of hell for some fun. Thank you Id software. Get this game my friends, for hell is waiting for you.
Super scary and graphics are amazing!!

Really, a good game from it's time that holds a lot of value better than that other 3xA shooters aren't bringing. It has a good atmosphere, and what I mean by that it puts you in the middle of a demon invasion and there are other people. GASP! I do comapare it to Dead Space and that game put you by yourself a whole lot! Here at least you find random scientist wholed up in a corner trying not to get eaten.

The horror aspect of this game comes from jumpscares. After a while, you'll learn to run up to the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and blow them with the shotty. But The jumpscares don't get tiresome, well at least for me. You expect them, but you'll never know from where, which is good.

This game also features the old health pack health system that is not present in today games, which is a shame by the way. This health mechanic makes sure that you're not just running like a muppet in the middle of an ambush from god knows where and a couple of seconds later, you are knee deep in ♥♥♥♥. This makes you think before oyu turn the corner.

The exploration is the typical go here, you need a key, get jumped by a gang of baddies, then proceed, but what makes it worth it is the audio logs. They may contain passwords, reports of things that make the PDA user ♥♥♥♥ their pants, the narration of some scientist that are just the victim of the {Spoiler] *#@$%$%^%$&$%&%$^&* and the 4325rtge45234r2 35, and that part when sdi02394q09wue. [end spoilers.] adds a layer of depth that no COD brought to the single player campaign. Hell, ( no pun intended,) sometimes it's necessary to listen to the droning of a tired out worker that just gets his stuff stolen and has to use a locker to secure his belongings and luck has it his PDA has the password.


Over all, if you had a chance to play Dead Space, you will love this game. It does drag out a little, but then again some of today's games are too damn short to justify $60. If you get the chance, get The Ultimate Doom collection along with ROE. This game is worth the money if you're into action horror games.

* Note* you will have to tinker with some files for Doom 3 to get it running 1920x1080, but its an easy fix.
Make sure you decide if the BFG version works best for you before investing in this version.\nMod-wise, this version has more options.

DOOM 3 is a fun game, quite worthy of the title DOOM. Despite being hard work making a sequel to the eternal classic DOOM and DOOM 2 Hell on Earth, Id software did it anyway and delivered a game quite similar to both of them, but evolved and adapted to modern graphics and gaming mechanics. DOOM 3 has it all: Imps, possessed soldiers, helldemons, flying skulls, hellbarons and the BFG. It also has a fun and scary storyline about the martian base being slowly devoured by hell due to teleporting experiments and some new elements, like the soul cube. A decent FPS game for newer gamers and a fun nostalgic game for everyone who played the original DOOM.

The only game that i ever bought a whole new gaming system for when it was released, and boy was it worth it!   Have to swith for the torch or weapon always kept you on your toes, the dark halls, the spine chilling sounds and enemies that would just crawl or jump straight at you from the darkness, always kept you on your toes.

An amazing FPS, almost a must play. It is not like the predecessors at all though, going for a much strong ominous, survival horror tone. It is quite an immersive game though and has aged somewhat well (thankfully mods are plentiful for this game including texture packs AND mods that make this game play like the predecessors if you like).\n\n

With gameplay alone, it's an above average shooter, but the ambience is great; most notably, the ambient sounds are superb and memorable. I would describe this as a haunted attraction where the (well costumed) actors actually attack you and you have to fight back. It's a ride, an experience and DOOM3 pulls it off nicely. The story is far from strong, but it's compelling enough and, with some imagination, can lead to more horrifying conclusions. The voice acting is good and, to reiterate, the sounds are what drives this home. If you like this game, check out the Resurrection of Evil expansion.
This is truly a great game. Id has not disappointed us. Fantastic! This one just might top all of the games in the doom series.

Let me get this straight - this game is not downright bad, but it's not a lot of fun either. Read on for more info.

A departure from the series' roots, the third DOOM makes itself into an atmospheric game, much like Metro. However, unlike Metro this game is not a lot of fun to play.

The best thing by far is the re-imaginations of the monsters, weapons and other entities from the original games. The climate comes just behind. Unfortunately, the combat is possibly the weakest point.

As I said in my joke-review the gameplay is about walking down maze-like corridors and stopping every few seconds to deal with an ambush. That would have been somewhat alright if not for the fact that a lot of these sections are identical. There are very few areas in the game which try to mix things up a bit. The weapons feel clumsy and cumbersome just like the movement, which doesn't help.

The only thing that justifies buying this game is the last third, which shakes up the level design of metallic corridors with hellish growth and lava. Enemies appear in groups of bigger than 2 at a time and from different angles. I sincerely enjoyed that part, but leading up to it felt tedious and I wouldn't want to do it again. Also, mods.

It kind of goes without saying that the original Doom was a hugley influencial game that basically defined what a first person shooter should be and inspired countless other games to follow in it's footsteps. Doom 3 takes a slightly different approach than the previous entries in the series. The story and atmosphere play more like Half-Life than classic Doom but that's actually a good thing. Instead of just mindlessly running around shooting monsters you'll be carefully checking out every corner and room for precious health, ammo and PDAs so you can figure out what the hell has been going on. It's very cinematic. The flashlight plays a key role in this as you'll need it to see into the shadows. Players that want every first person shooter to be the same will be annoyed by this but it's inclusion kicks the intensity up a few notches.

Speaking of light this is the type of game you'll want to play with all the lights off (or not). Even over a decade later the visuals and dark atmosphere are still impressive and often just downright unnerving. The human characters are a little on the blocky side but the demons, futuristic machinery and realtime lighting do a great job in immersing you in the environment. The sound design is also very well done with very effective and creepy ambiant noises. There is some seriously scary stuff going on in the walls and air vents in this game. Headphone users be advised.

Note: This is the version to buy and not the BFG Edition" which has brightened graphics and screws up key features (flashlight is no longer selectable). Basically just a misguided cash grab. Avoid."

Honestly this game is one of the best I've ever played. Sure it's nothing similar to the original and Hell is barely there but the game itself honestly is just good. My only complaint is the way the pacing is but it's more meant to be a horror game so it's no big deal. Also if you're wanting to get the BFG edition then feel free to a bit dissapointed due to it feels more like a downgrade. Overall the game itself and the expansion gets a 9/10 for me.
One of my favorite fps ever, and it still holds up to this day. Plus, this is the best copy of a Doom game you'll find on steam, as Final, Ultimate and 2 are basically raw wads and BFG is BFG.

Its a good game. Great atmoshpere and voice acting for a game made in 2004 BUT it has the worst bug ive seen in a game to date. Not long after you encounter your first enemies, they turn invisible. sometimes theres a floating head or flickering bodise that seem to attack you. Also your own character is affected by this. You gun constantly flickers and so does your character model, making them game unbearable to play. I do recommend to get it, but look up solutions for this bug first.
Amazing Game.  Prefer this over the bfg edition.  this game got me into high end pc gaming back in august of 04.  its an old school style of game, but is alot slower than doom 1 and 2.  Nostalgia!

I played this game when it was new and I didn't like it much. I played it today, and I still didnt like it.

positives:
+ I LOVE the interactive display screens. I can't understand why this is not used in more games.
+ story around the game (not main story) is quite interestiog. I enjoyed the mars history, audio logs etc
+ graphics was great, and the light and darkness is interesting even now.
+ level design can be good.


negatives:
- what I hate most, are enemies. they are not hard, they are not strong, the AI is nonexistent. all that is going on is, that they jump at you from darkness, or spawn behind your back. that is it, all they can do. that is all the game offers. monsters just spawns around you because reasons.
- if you recieve a hit, your screen will jerk violently, often causing you to miss another shot. even if it is weakest spider, it will kick your screen and it is just stupid. you think you will move away? wrong, most likely just spawned another impe behind your back. it is not challenging, it is just stupid and annoying and frustrating. shotgun soldier will kick you back 2 meters with each shot. machine gun soldier can be so annoying. what tought this is good idea???
- after a while you just run trough dark areas, knowing that that enemies will jump you but stopped caring. no matter if you move carefully or run, they will jump you either way.
- I actually hated most of the guns. don't know why, first half of the game I used shotgun (so blind you use it at ranges slightly higher then chainsaw) and machinegun (only enjoyable and accurate gun), second half I added chaingun (little less blind then shotgun) and plasma gun (super slow projectiles). 50 granades, 50 rockets and 25 bfg charges? meh, who cares. granades were specially useless.
- for whatever reason, you can't interrupt reloading (change to different weapon) to change weapon. except shotgun
- you have to choose if you want to use flashlight or weapon. that probably should create horror atmosphere, but it is just stupid.  you can choose, if you want to see the enemies, or shoot them. who came with that idea?
- you have to edit cfg files to set graphical settings.


I don't know what people see at this game. 4/10
Fantastic! I wish modern FPS and Horror games where more like this and it was much longer then i thought it would be.

The only game that i ever bought a whole new gaming system for when it was released, and boy was it worth it!   Have to swith for the torch or weapon always kept you on your toes, the dark halls, the spine chilling sounds and enemies that would just crawl or jump straight at you from the darkness, always kept you on your toes.

this game scares the ♥♥♥♥ out of me

you should totally get the Absolute HD mod for this. makes the game look passable for modern with the hd texture pack. runs like a dream.

if you run AMD graphics cards you have to rename the doom3.exe because catalyst ai will do wonky things with the textures like mirror the player on walls. i renamed to doom 3.exe, yes the space works.

I Don't have the BFG Edition and regretably I wish i had. The edition i have won't Work Properly if at all. I TRied to get a refund for a pruduct that did not work. But no luck. I will Be Reinstalling so i can try to upload a vidieo of the results to add to this review when i have time for it.

Cons:
slow start, very dark, repetitive, linear, sikkmod can be a bit of a pain to set up

Pros:
oozes creepy atmosphere, great scary lighting, killing monsters over and over, none of that stupid mission stuff (your mission is to kick demon keister), sikkmod is @&!?ing awesome

Should have been more focus on multiplayer from day 1 (why no quake 3 type bots?) but, there is multiplayer and mod bots (try Full Metal Jacket), and this game is totally worth it for the singleplayer and mod maps (Shambler's Castle was my favorite. Zombie Shuffle was funny). Why you no killing demons right now???

Looks promising at start but this game can get a bit boring after several hours of gameplay. Not that this game is bad but I don't find the jump scares even slightly scary. The mechanics are your typical FPS back in the day and it's quite playable. The music is ♥♥♥♥ing awsome for main menu and also the ambience sound can be erie. The graphics back then looked quite good but it all looked similar since it was mostly generic corridors I was running down. I'd recommend this if you can get it cheap but it's not a good game by today's standards. BTW Windows vista/7 being not supported is a lie. Works quite well actually out of the box but widescreen resolutions require some file editing. Haven't tested it on Windows 10 yet.

Decent story, solid mechanics, tight clausterphobic level design, creepy atmosphere. 7/10
Really loved the suspense when I was in dark areas.
good older game
10/10 would play crane game with explosive barrels again.
