reviewText:
If you get this version of the game, I highly recommend you go and find the Duct Tape mod, which gives you a flashlight for your shotgun and your machine gun (and ONLY those two guns, but that's better than nothing).

I really don't hav emuch else to say about the game. It is an excellent modernized reimagining of the original version of DOOM. The game is atmospheric and action packed, which is what it's supposed to be. I understand some folks would say it's  not that scary, but it's not supposed to be. You're a badass space marine with a load of weapons, so yeah, you're supposed to feel like a one-man army.
Still holds up as one of the best FPS survival horror games ever made in 2016.
Game costs $9.99 + Your soul included! :)\n\n10/10
This game is good! ;]\n

First off, I DO actually recommend this game, but go ahead and get the BFG edition. This original version of Doom 3 still doesn't support 1080p, and has minimal graphics options.\n\nDoom 3 is a fun, classic horror game but I wouldn't advise getting this outdated original version.

DOOM 3 is a serviceable 2004 horror shooter that just happens to be a Doom game, for better and worse. It's not quite on the level of its forebears, but it's not terrible either. At the very least, download Killatomate's Realistic Weapons mod to make your firepower not garbage. And avoid the BFG Edition - it screws with gameplay balance, and is incompatible with mods, of which there's plenty to make OG look even better than BFG. (I didn't like the BFG ports of classic Doom either: they modify the games too much and run poorly.)


So hey, this is still Doom, right? There's too much ammo and health lying around to really qualify Doom 3 as survival horror, so it must be. While I think the game could absolutely have used more open spaces, I don't mind the game mainly taking place in linear corridors because they are very good corridors.

Lot of PDAs lying around to collect though, and only like two or three female characters in the entire game - so you know this is a 2004 production. It's a shame as linear as it is, since a branching plot point (an actual one, mind) would have been a good gameplay point, not to mention a bit of a callback to the classics.

The biggest criticism of Doom 3's gameplay is that every other encounter is a cheap 'gotcha' or some sort of monster closet, most of which get predictable after a while. The originals did this too, but not nearly as much nor as egregiously. System Shock had respawning enemies; maybe that would have worked here instead.

Don't get me wrong, this game builds enough tension that it can get away with jumpscares every so often, and it's not like they're obnoxious full-screen find the hidden object" crap
date: but Silent Hill this ain't. While I would argue Doom 3 actually pulls off its horror much better than it does its terror
recommended:
that doesn't excuse the entirely scripted monster closets getting old after a whole.


Doom 3's story is...well
hoursPlayed: it exists. For the most part
voteText: it doesn't detract from the game. You might wonder what Doom is doing with such an overt story
helpfulPercent: but really
votesHelpful: iD couldn't not write one in 2004. Games had come a long way since 1993
votesTotal: and writing in games at the time was just starting to become more than a vestigial element. To illustrate my point
votesFunny: they've come even further since 2004 with MachineGames' Wolfenstein: The New Order - a continuation of iD's only shooter franchise that's older than Doom - having writing that actually adds to that game.\n\nAnyway. One of the two main problems here are the lack of sound effects in the audio logs
commentsCount: a problem I'll mention the System Shock games didn't have. The other is the fact that Dr. Betruger is by far the most corny
column16: hokey
column17: Snidely Whiplash-evil character in any FPS ever
column18:
and that's REALLY saying something.

I don't even need to spoil the fact that he's evil because you see it coming from a mile away the moment you first see him. His name is literally German for 'betrayal'. He veers between creepy and funny nearly every time you hear him say you're DOOOOOMED!!! MUAHAHAHA!!! He's the one vestigal element Doom 3 would have been almost entirely better off without.


This game was honestly never going to live up to the originals. Mainly because the originals were much more progressive and envelope-pushing at exactly the right time
column19: and were much more flexible to boot
column20: but also because they were products of the late stage of videogaming's 'childhood'.\n\nDoom 3
column22: is a product of video gaming's adolescent period. It trades those gracefully aging MIDI riffs and pixels for surplus buckets of grimness and horror
column23: a look that while probably very fluid and good for 2004
column24: doesn't hold up that well today without mods. It's worth mentioning though that the game's code is very well-written
column25: and that the most taxing element for 2004 PCs - the dynamic lighting engine - is still fairly impressive.\n\nBoth of those accomplishments come with a caveat
column27: in that the whole game could frankly be summed up as a long-form tech demo for the developers' id Tech 4 engine
column28: which they later leased out to other developers. I will
column30: praise the interactive computer interfaces as being truly excellent and something I'd like to see more of today.\n\nUltimately? If you can deal with the fact that
column32: this game has kind of aged more than the originals in its series
column33: you will find a Doom game that's still pretty entertaining at times."

Doom 3 is the most story driven of all of the other Doom games (except for Doom 4). It's atmosphere is very vivid and frightning at times, and eerie, kinda like System Shock 2. A lot of jumpscares in this game. I really don't care for it on PC as much as I would for Xbox or Playstation. For me on PC, some of the enemies become invisible at times and framerate begins to drop and textures glitch out. Other than that, this game is great. 8/10. I highly reccomend giving Doom 3 a try if you havn't played a Doom game before.

reviewText: Fantastic Game for its age

Doom is one of my childhood best memories , I had so much fun playing Doom 1 and Doom 2.

Doom 3 didnt quite feel like classic Dooms but it was still Doom. Belive it or not Doom 3 did something better then original Dooms , the scare. I wasnt really scared in old Dooms but in this one there id that scare element which I love.

My biggest complain about Doom 3 is that were always in some hallway or a small room.

Buy this .
